text: one simple step firms can take
is M make sure that people that are
getting paid a lot of money say more
than a million or two that a big chunk
of that money is
deferred that's going to change the
whole ball game because the the money
has to be deferred with what they call
clawback which means they can get it
back if I lose it all so that guy who's
making 10 million a year selling credit
to fa swaps if we're going to keep five
million of it in escrow for 10
years and with the right to go back and
get it if he starts losing money then
we're going to give people the right
incentives not to take so much risk the
same with the mortgage brokers that
were selling people mortgages they
couldn't afford we we shouldn't pay them
on each mortgage they
write they should they should have what
they call skin in the
game um where it they've got to
reimburse us if the guy who sold the
mortgage
defaults and um so I I I think that
there are lessons that the financial
services industry can
learn and uh as I said they should
either aggressively take these steps on
their own or expect uh Congress to act
